blurb: Track down the subjects of Shakespeare’s sonatas in London.
You’re the final girl in a horror movie and must defeat the evil monster.
Arrange city cards from a tiny deck to complete planning goals.
Read through a story full of choices to embark on quests.
Draw cards with fantasy features and plot them on your own map.
Draw routes  on your board to form a rail and road network.
An interrogation to determine if a player is a human or robot.
Secretly place and reveal court members to protect the princess.

game: Paris: La Cité de la Lumière
blurb: Place lampposts and buildings to create the city of lights.
It’s chess!
A Magic the Gathering format all about playing Blue from the same deck.
Tactically play argument cards to sway the jury in an asymmetrical trial.
Battle your miniature warbands using cards in a tactical arena.
Arrange the skulls of the Sedlec Ossuary to meet the deceased’s last wishes.
Act as monarch growing your kingdom.
Solve mysteries with Sherlock Holmes.
Use ruthless economic strategy to create the dominate fashion house.
Work together to play fireworks cards—that only the other players can see!
Create your own crossword as fast as possible.
As a suitor, use a small deck of courtiers to get your love letter closer to the Princess.
Be the first to place all your complex shapes on a crowded board.
Fight fire, and friends, with fire using cards to place or remove flames.
Trade cards for the best friends, the most pizza and toys, and the coolest fort.
Travel a changing globe to stop the spread of disease.
Use randomly distributed resources to build on a small island.
Play a grove of trees using symbiotic mushrooms to grow.
Each forest faction plays a different asymmetrical game.
Correctly place your historical events on a growing timeline.
Shape a land of empire and exile with favors, secrets, and the land’s many denizens.
Play cards in time with a funky beat to create a solid hip hop song.
Set up your fantasy shop to make the most profit while ‘helping’ defend the town.
Each detective receives limited clues and must quietly pass them to their partners.
James only knows riichi.
A multiplayer Magic the Gathering format using decks with legendary leaders.
Time travel to protect the space-time continuum.
In a town with too many detectives, be sure you don’t accuse the wrong suspect.
Carefully lay your string railway tracks to build a network to touch key stations.
Build your city to maximize collection or randomly rolled resources.
Stop at tourist spots along the road to Edo to have the best Japanese vacation!
Gather train cards of the right color to claim routes around the US.
Play Go-Fish to collect complete collections of famous authors’ works.
Ask yes-or-no questions to find a secret, but don’t be misled by the Insider.
Answer devious questions about semantics, etymology, and grammar.
Time your cycling team’s effort to always be in second till the very end.

game: Betrayal at House on the Hill
blurb: Explore a spooky house… until friends turns against you!
Do your best to draw an object purely from memory.
Answer generation based trivia questions about pop culture.
Read each other’s minds to hit the bullseye between binaries.
Politic and vote to balance the needs of the kingdom and your desires.
Everyone knows where you’re working except one spy trying to blend in.

game: A Fake Artist Goes to New York
blurb: Artists add to a collective drawing, but the fake doesn’t know what it is!
Work out what happened when everyone’s eyes were closed.
Communicate secret messages with a single clue that applies to many words.
Codenames, but with pictures instead of words.
Describe famous people using an increasingly limited set of tools.
Pass liberal or fascist laws, without knowing who’s on your side.
Swap hostages between two rooms to save or kill the president.
A real-world game played on public transit.
Work together to solve climate change.
Grab conveyor-belt sushi to make delicious combos!
Bet on a wild and wacky mascot race!
Solve mysteries inspired by Lovecraftian horror.
Solve visual word puns.
